intro: Pseudoxandra guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan pseudoxandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland and montane rainforests.
